final_answer: The humor in the image comes from the juxtaposition of the two calendars. On the left, the wall calendar with a palm tree sketch suggests a vacation or relaxation period from the 20th to the 26th. On the right, the menstrual calendar shows the same dates with symbols for menstruation. The "YES, BUT" text highlights the contrast between the expectation of relaxation and an unavoidable reality for many women. The satire lies in the way plans can be unconsciously disrupted by natural cycles, adding an ironic twist to the idea of a “carefree” time.
ground_truth: The images are funny since they show how women plan out holidays with much care but their menstrual cycles ruin their plans by causing trouble due to bleeding and discomfort that occur during menstruation
